Connecticut School Shooting

Police: Gunman forced his way into school

Distraught residents left the fire station after hearing news of their loved ones from officials in Newtown, Conn. Don Emmert/AFP/Getty Images
A tribute by the Brazilian association Rio de Paz to the victims on the beach of Copacabana in Rio de Janeiro. World leaders expressed shock and horror over the massacre. Christophe Simon/AFP/Getty Images
Lt. J. Paul Vance of the Connecticut State Police conducted a news briefing Saturday,, where he gave the latest updates in the school shooting. Jason DeCrow/AP photo
A message for the victims was written on a candle outside the St. Rose of Lima Roman Catholic Church, in Newtown, Conn. David Goldman/AP photo
Balloons hung from the Sandy Hook School sign as residents of the small Connecticut community of Newtown were reeling on Saturday from one of the worst mass shootings in US history. Shannon Stapleton/Reuters
An American flag was at half-staff as dawn broke Saturday in Newtown, Conn. Jason DeCrow/AP photo
People gathered for a prayer vigil at St. Rose Church following the elementary school shooting in Newtown, Conn. Ammanuek Dunande/AFP/Getty Images
The tribute in Brazil contained a message for the victims and mourners in the Connecticut shooting as people across the globe mourned the tragedy. Christophe Simon/AFP/Getty Images
The families of victims grieved near Sandy Hook Elementary School. Adrees Latif/Reuters
President Obama wiped his eye as he spoke about the elementary school shooting. Charles Dharapak/AP
People lit candles in the aftermath of a shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School. Essdras M Suarez/Globe Staff
Three women attending a vigil in Newtown, Conn. consoled each other. Essdras M Suarez/Globe Staff
A woman waited to hear about her sister, a teacher, following the shooting at the school. Jessica Hill/AP
A victim's family left a firehouse staging area following the shooting. Jessica Hill/AP
Young children waited outside Sandy Hook Elementary School after the shooting. Michelle McLoughlin/Reuters
Police patrolled the streets outside the elementary school. Adrees Latif/Reuters
Connecticut State Police led children from the Sandy Hook Elementary School. Shannon Hicks, Newtown Bee/AP
A child reacted to police staged nearby Sandy Hook Elementary School where a gunman opened fire. Adrees Latif/Reuters

Police find 'very good' evidence on gunman

State police Lt. Paul Vance said they hoped the evidence would answer questions about the gunman's motives. (AP, 11:10 a.m.)

Opinion | Joan Vennochi

'Gun control' treated
like vile curse words

“Gun control” isn’t an expletive. There must be a conversation about it because we need to do more to protect our children and ourselves.

A successful model for urban
cycling in Portland, Ore.

Portland led the way in taking the risk out of cycling with master planning that today aims for cycling to account for 25 percent of city trips by 2030.

Local government cuts hit economy

Since the recession ended in 2009, local governments have eliminated nearly 500,000 jobs, including 10,000 in Massachusetts.
Opinion | Lawrence Harmon

Judging the judges in Mass.

Judicial independence is alive and well in Mass. where judges enjoy appointments until age 70. It’s judicial accountability that is dying a painful death.

Young girl returns the gift of giving

Kaia Rose Sooknanan-Andrew, 7, who spent a Christmas at Tufts Medical Center remembered the presents she received and decided to do the same for others.
Opinion | Adrian Walker

Newtown tragedy was preventable

Every single one of these shooting rampages might have been prevented if getting hold of a gun in this country was as difficult as, say, getting a driver’s ­license.
